title: Australia’s best photos of the month – January 2025
description: Elvis, summer sport and stinky flowers. Guardian Australia looks back at some of the month’s most striking images Continue reading...
author: Guardian Staff
excerpt: Elvis, summer sport and stinky flowers. Guardian Australia looks back at some of the month’s most striking images
text: Bereavement Assistance in collaboration with the crew of Enterprize, spread the ashes of over 70 people in Hobsons Bay, from a 27-metre full-scale replica of a ship built in Hobart in 1830. Eight white doves were released from the Enterprize after the ashes were scattered. Photograph: Sean Davey/The Guardian People march towards Flinders Street station during an Invasion Day rally in Melbourne. Photograph: Diego Fedele/AAP Elvis impersonator Stanley Cichy waits to board a train at Sydney’s Central station heading for the Parkes Elvis festival. Photograph: Don Arnold/WireImage Dillon Stith of the Cairns Taipans attempts to secure the ball during the round 16 NBL match against the Sydney Kings at Qudos Bank Arena. Photograph: Mark Kolbe Photography/Getty Images Dale, the pigeon man from Potts Point, has been homeless most of his life. He takes care of pigeons when they are injured and has found happiness among birds. Photograph: Carly Earl/The Guardian Elizabeth Cameron Dalman OAM is a pioneer and icon of dance in Australia. She is the owner of the Mirramu Creative Arts Centre in Bungendore, and is over 90 years old - but as she puts it, dancers are ‘ageless’. Photograph: Teagan Glenane/The Guardian Former NSW premier and foreign minister, Bob Carr takes on a new role and will chair the board of the Museums of History NSW. Photograph: Jessica Hromas/The Guardian India’s Jasprit Bumrah celebrates taking the wicket of Australia’s Marnus Labuschagne on day two of the fifth men’s Test match at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Photograph: Darrian Traynor/Getty Images Sarah Monteaux in the role of Ophelia at Melbourne’s last theatre restaurant, Witches and Britches. Photograph: Christopher Hopkins/The Guardian James Temelkovski and Alexander Bonetig of the Wanderers compete with Oliver Jones of the Bulls during the round 11 A-League Men match in Sydney. Photograph: Brendon Thorne/Getty Images Bree Myers and her daughter, Indie Francis, outside their house in Dimboola, Victoria, as bushfires rage nearby. Photograph: Diego Fedele/AAP People inspect ‘Putricia’, the corpse flower at the Botanical Gardens Sydney, before the smelly flower bloomed. Photograph: Jessica Hromas/The Guardian Anna King has suffered with severe withdrawal symptoms from selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) for years after stopping the antidepressants. Photograph: Rémi Chauvin/The Guardian Ben Dowling of Australia is lifted for a catch against South Africa during the HSBC World Rugby Sevens Series at HBF Park in Perth. Photograph: Paul Kane/Getty Images Colin Hood and Lindy Chaplin-Holmes are a couple, but they have decided to live separately. Lindy lives in Yallambie, a 30-minute drive from Colin’s flat in Carlton North. Photograph: Christopher Hopkins/The Guardian Lightning seen from Anzac Memorial Bridge in Newcastle. Photograph: Roni Bintang/Getty Images Australia’s Darcie Brown bowls during game three of the T20 International Women’s Ashes series at Adelaide Oval. Photograph: Sarah Reed/Cricket Australia/Getty Images Jo Nemeth has lived without money for the past 10 years, a choice she made after feeling overwhelmed by the stress of rising living costs and guilt over contributing to consumption. Photograph: Natalie Grono/The Guardian Sasha Harmond and Matthew Schulz sleep rough in Brisbane. Sasha’s eight-year-old son died recently and his memorial box, along with Sasha’s other belongings were removed from her tent by city officials. Photograph: David Kelly/The Guardian The peloton in full flight during the Santos Tour Down Under 2025 in Adelaide. Photograph: Dario Belingheri/Getty Images Kodie Mason, a Dharawal, Ngarigo and Dunghutti woman who grew up with her family on La Perouse Aboriginal Reserve. She has been weaving since she was little, a skill passed down from her grandfather. She now teaches weaving. Photograph: Bec Lorrimer/The Guardian Topics Australia news Elvis Presley Cricket Photography Basketball Bob Carr Cycling
html:
